Published by Oxford University Press.SUMMARY: We present bammds, a practical tool that allows visualization of samples sequenced by second-generation sequencing when compared with a reference panel of individuals (usually genotypes) using a multidimensional scaling algorithm. Our tool is aimed at determining the ancestry of unknown samples-typical of ancient DNA data-particularly when only low amounts of data are available for those samples.AVAILABILITY AND IMPLEMENTATION: The software package is available under GNU General Public License v3 and is freely available together with test datasets https://savannah.nongnu.org/projects/bammds/. It is using R (http://www.r-project.org/), parallel (http://www.gnu.org/software/parallel/), samtools (https://github.com/samtools/samtools).CONTACT: bammds-users@nongnu.orgSUPPLEMENTARY INFORMATION: Supplementary data are available at Bioinformatics online.
publication.title: bammds: a tool for assessing the ancestry of low-depth whole-genome data using multidimensional scaling (MDS)

summary.description: Software that allows to create a multidimensional scaling (MDS) plot of populations for genetic data.
summary.name: bammds
